translation1: "All Bosch electrical tools, pneumatic tools, and measuring tools are carefully inspected, tested, and subject to the strict controls of Bosch quality assurance. Bosch therefore provides a guarantee for Bosch electrical tools, pneumatic tools, and measuring tools. The warranty claims of the buyer from the purchase contract with the seller, as well as any legal rights, are not restricted by this guarantee.For these tools, we provide warranty according to the following conditions: We provide warranty in accordance with the following regulations (Nos. 2-7) by repairing the defects in the tool that are demonstrably due to a material or manufacturing error within the warranty period. The warranty period is 24 months, 12 months for commercial or professional use or equivalent wear and tear.The warranty period begins with the purchase by the original buyer. The relevant date is the one on the original purchase receipt. For all blue, commercial electric and precision tools (excluding high-frequency tools, industrial battery-powered screwdrivers, and pneumatic tools) purchased after September 1, 2004, the warranty period is extended to 36 months if the buyer registers these tools within 4 weeks of the purchase date.Battery packs and chargers, as well as any accompanying accessories, are excluded from this guarantee extension. Registration can only be done online at [www.bosch-pt.com/warranty](http://www.bosch-pt.com/warranty). As proof, the registration confirmation must be printed immediately, as well as the original purchase receipt, which shows the date of purchase.A registration is only possible if the buyer agrees to the storage of his data entered there. The following are excluded from the guarantee: parts that are subject to wear and tear due to normal use or any other natural wear and tear, as well as defects in the tool that are due to normal use or any other natural wear and tear, anomalous environmental conditions, foreign operating conditions, overloading, or insufficient maintenance or care. Defects in the tool caused by the use of non-Bosch spare parts, accessories, or replacement parts.Tools that have undergone changes or additions. Minor deviations from the desired state that are insignificant for the value and usability of the tool. The remedy for the defect we recognize as warranty-worthy is carried out in such a way that we repair the defective tool free of charge or replace it with a flawless tool (possibly also a subsequent model).Replaced tools or parts become our property."

We offer warranty for this tool under the following conditions: We offer a warranty according to the measures of the following provisions (No. 2-7) via free repair of the tool defect, which can demonstrably be traced back to a material or manufacturing error on the part of the manufacturer within the warranty period. The warranty period is 24 months, 12 months for commercial, professional or similar usage. The warranty period begins with the purchase by the first end customer. The authoritative date is on the original receipt of purchase. If the buyer registered the tools within the first 4 weeks after the date of purchase, then all commercial blue electronic tools and measuring tools (excluding high-frequency tools, industrial battery-powered screwdrivers and compressed air tools) purchased since September 1st, 2004 have an extended warranty period of 36 months. translation1: "Tire choice for racing bikes - is it really as safe as they say? I've been eagerly awaiting today, as I wanted to train a bit for my upcoming cycling tour next week. So, I said and did it, and I rode my racing bike, which I bought yesterday on eBay.The first 40km were also really beautiful - but then what always lurks in every city center (this time: Thank you Krefeld!) happened. Glass shards on the route. Zack, loud hissing, and my rear tire didn't want to continue the rest of the way.Since I couldn't really buy a replacement jacket and hose due to the day of the week, I had to turn around with half-hearted mood and take the first train home. It wasn't quite as bad as it sounds, maybe it's better if I practice the tire change again before the bike tour. But now I'm facing a question and I hope you can help me.Since I have a relatively long distance to cover over several days, I would really hate to have this problem frequently. Now it wasn't that bad, as the old tires from the previous owner (a very nice old man who had driven until 2:12 PM on the day I picked up the bike and covered 140km!) were still on the bike, and he had already described them as suboptimal because he had driven many years on them. However, when I think that I still need to change the tires after 80-90km, I am not in a good mood: DNow I have come into conversation with an older man at the platform, who surprised me by asking why I didn't have the Marathon Plus tires; these are supposed to be unbeatable. Now it all sounds very tempting. But are they really so indestructible?I don't want to spend 40€/rear tire right now, just to be disappointed later. Furthermore, I wonder: I currently have 25x622 on my racing bike. Although it is also available (apparently) for Marathon Plus tires, the majority is already wider.Is this a problem? Or would you generally recommend other tires to me for a racing bike? The Schwalbe side seems to be my absolute favorite! I would rather recommend the Durano DD to those with less knowledge.Thank you already in advance for the help and loving greetings!"

reference: Picking tires for a road bike - life without popped tires? This morning I woke up with a fiery drive because I still wanted to at least train a bit in the upcoming weeks in preparation for my upcoming bicycle tour. It was as easy as that and I drove my road bike which I had bought on eBay the day before. The first 40 km were really beautiful - but then that happened which is always waiting for you in the intercity (this time: thanks goes to Krefeld!). Glass shards on the road. Pop, a loud hiss and my back tire was no longer up for riding the rest of the trip. Because of it being a work day, I didn’t really have the chance to acquire a spare tire and tube, I had to turn back halfway through in a bad mood and take the next workable train back home. It was not the worst downer ever, maybe it is even better if I practice changing tires one more time before I leave to go on the tour. But now I am posed with a question and hope that you will be able to help me. Because I have a relatively long stretch of road and many days in front of me, I would very much like to not run into this problem on a regular basis. This time it really wasn’t that bad, because the tires were from the previous owner (a very nice old man, who had already rode 120 km by 2 PM on the day I came to pick up my bicycle) and because he had described them as suboptimal, because he had already been wearing them down for many years. But if I think about having to change tires every 80-90 km on the tour, then I am already in a really bad mood :D I just got into a discussion with an older man at the train platform, who asked me quite surprised, why I don’t have the Marathon Plus tires, these are supposed to be impossible to pop. Now that certainly does sound tempting. But are they really so indestructible? I have no desire to give out €40 per tire in order to just be disappointed. At the same time, I ask myself: I am using 25x622 race tires at the moment, I believe. This is (apparently?) just like the Marathon Plus tires, but the majority of tires are actually wider. Is that the real problem? Or would you recommend that I really get different tires in general for the road bike? The Schwalbe website seems to be of one opinion! Would common sense tend to recommend the Durano DD? Thank you in advance for your help and take care!

After 22 minutes, it seemed that the last twice-winless Hesse were on their way to another Bundesliga disaster.But then the SGE turned around and within an hour, the frustration from a mediocre season start was thrown off and they won furiously with 5:2. \"It's crazy what the guys have achieved today,\" jubilated coach Oliver Glasner to DAZN and gave a \"general compliment to everyone who was involved.\" It initially looked like another dampener for the Frankfurt team, who are still behind their expectations in ninth place. Patrik Schick had put Leverkusen ahead 2-0.What then happened, even impressed the SGE trainer. \"How the players then returned and showed a fantastic performance,\" Glasner continued. I am crazy happy with the performance we showed and of course with the result.Even defender Christopher Lenz, who was able to return to the field for the first time since the fourth game due to his recovered muscle injury, emphasized the morale of his teammates. \"I believe our mental attitude is incredible,\" said the 27-year-old, who was particularly pleased with the result for the fans. That was the party we wanted to throw today.For the upcoming tasks, Glasner wants to keep the focus on himself, but is also well-positioned in terms of personnel. It is exceptional that we have all players fit in December and that all players are in top physical condition. It is top work in our medical department, but the players also live highly professionally.Now we want to \"take it step by step and stay humble\" and complete the tasks until the end of the year \"at this level\". Next, there is already a away game scheduled for Wednesday as part of the English week against Borussia Mönchengladbach (18:30, Sky)."

Whether you want to take on this risk is, of course, up to you :)"
reference: I also think that as a general rule, children should not be expected to overtake a parental role for their younger siblings. However, I think it is also good for older siblings to care for the younger ones to some degree. Sometimes check-up on them, sometimes help, sometimes get the bottle, etc. They learn responsibility this way, help within the family and are thus connected with it. As long as they can continue to be a kid themselves, I don’t see the problem. If your first child looks after themselves alone for a short amount of time, that is OK, that is actually good. You can best get a sense of whether or not this works for your children. It is not as if they should change the second child’s diaper and sit for hours by them as they fall asleep. It is probably questionable from a strictly legal perspective. Maybe the psychologist would also have something to say about it. Since if something actually does happen, like a fire, break-in, earthquake, alien invasion, etc., it would be too much responsibility for child 1 to take care of child 2. If that is a risk that you would like to take that is up to you, of course ;)

translation1: "Heavy \"Huidlerer\" question: Amberg knows the solution. What please is an \"Huidlerer\"? On which the man from Amberg provided the solution and probably also caused amazement among many Upper Palatinate people. \"The Huidlerer,\" the viewers learned, \"is a cloth used to wipe the oven.\"Dialect researcher Antony Rowley, who has been consulted as an expert by Bavarian Television for years, confirmed this. With the comment that this is a typical Upper Palatinate term, somehow derived from the more familiar dialect word \"Houdern\". translation1: "Friedrich wins 60th World Cup event - Nolte wins two-man bob - Sport The brand of the Norwegian biathlete Ole Einar Björndalen with 94 victories is the goal of the bobsled pilot. \"I've calculated it, I would need to win nine and a half races per season to reach it by Cortina 2026,\" said the double Olympic champion from BSC Oberbärenburg, who scored two victories in two days at the races in Winterberg.First, he defended against Johannes Lochner's attack on Saturday by moving up from third to first place. Then he made some changes to the material settings and drove a larger gap on Sunday with 0.30 seconds. With his teammates Thorsten Margis (SV Halle), Candy Bauer (BSC Oberbärenburg), and Alexander Schüller (SV Halle), he beat the British Brad Hall.Third place went to Austrian Benjamin Maier. \"We went for a bigger risk today and were rewarded,\" said Friedrich, who also scored his 22nd consecutive victory. The Stuttgart-bound Berchtesgadener Johannes Lochner came in second place before this, but this time he finished in fifth place.Christoph Hafer from BC Bad Feilnbach landed in eighth place after finishing fourth in the first race. \"If I knew what he did differently, I would also do it,\" said Lochner. Nolte won at home - Jamanka on the podium.Laura Nolte achieved her third season victory in the two-woman bob at home. After finishing only in fourth place in the monobob the day before, she raced to the World Cup victory with her pusher Deborah Levi on Sunday. Two-woman bob Olympic champion Mariama Jamanka from BRC Thüringen came in second with Germany's fastest sprinter, Alexandra Burghardt from Burghausen.You qualified for the Olympics alongside your first podium finish in this winter. Wiesbaden's Kim Kalicki finished in third place with Leonie Fiebig. It was super cool for me to get my first podium finish in the World Cup, and I'm super happy that Mariama is joining me.I am very happy with the development.
